summary: The bill, titled the SAFE Sunscreen Standards Act, aims to expedite the regulatory review process for sunscreen active ingredients. It amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act by establishing new standards for evaluating the safety and effectiveness of these ingredients, allowing for the use of real-world evidence and non-animal testing methods. The bill also mandates a final administrative order on pending submissions and requires annual reports to Congress regarding implementation progress and transparency. Its core focus is to improve access to effective sunscreens and reduce skin cancer incidence.
